page.syntax: ASCII_Value as N = ASC(C character[,L unsigned])

argument.name: unsigned
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. and .T. = Return a positive number for high-order characters, .F. = Return a negative number for high-order characters.

page.description: Returns the ASCII value of a character.
page.discussion: ASC() returns the integer ASCII_Value of the first letter in the specified Character_String. The inverse function of ASC() is CHR().
page.example: dim FIRSTNAME as C FIRSTNAME = "Borg" ? asc(FIRSTNAME) = 66 ? asc( chr(67) ) = 67 ? asc("N") = 78 ? asc( chr(252) ) = -4 ? asc(chr(252), .t.) = 252
